name: Eddington Luminosity
latex: L_{Edd} = \frac{4\pi G M m_p c}{\sigma_T} \approx 3.3 \times 10^4 \frac{M}{M_\odot} L_\odot
explanation: Eddington luminosity is maximum luminosity object can have before radiation pressure overcomes gravity. Above this limit, radiation pushes matter away faster than gravity can pull it in. Determines maximum brightness of accreting objects (black holes, neutron stars). Used to understand active galactic nuclei and X-ray binaries.

examples.problem: What is Eddington luminosity for 10 solar mass black hole?
Why can't objects exceed Eddington luminosity?
examples.solution: Radiation pressure would blow away accreting matter
steps: Matter pushed away faster than it falls in
